item.title: 315 – Blessing (Cold)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Cold) Robin’s egg sky cracked a line of white cloud of breath hung a moment. Sage brittles as I pass, shaking frost. Juniper felled at the turnaround split to the roots. If you spit today make a wish before … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Cold)

Robin’s egg sky cracked
a line of white
cloud of breath
hung a moment.

Sage brittles as I pass,
shaking frost. Juniper
felled at the turnaround
split to the roots.

If you spit today
make a wish before
it hits the ground.
Teardrops shatter.

Wind dies at sunset.
Hands huddle fists
in pockets. Stars fade
in, salting the sky.

I worry needlessly
for the deer and jays.
I should know better
to worry for myself.

item.title: 314 – Blessing (Vespers)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Vespers) When I look up at last from the day’s bent work the sun is a smear of red, one last scrape hung over the canyon. The world contracts to its essential edges. I pause mid-stride to breathe the juniper … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Vespers)

When I look up at last
from the day’s bent work
the sun is a smear
of red, one last scrape
hung over the canyon.

The world contracts
to its essential edges.

I pause mid-stride
to breathe the juniper
and coming cold snap.
The river runs clear
at the bottom, singing vespers
over the frozen stones.

item.title: 313 – Blessing (Tile)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Tile) Man’s mind made to make right angles cut & angle & curse awkward eighths & at length eke out a thin-shimmed grace of a tough corner no paint there only hard edged porcelain and porcelain’s sharp echo the wet-saw shirrs … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Tile)

Man’s mind made
to make right
angles cut & angle & curse
awkward eighths
& at length eke out
a thin-shimmed grace
of a tough corner
no paint there
only hard edged porcelain
and porcelain’s sharp echo
the wet-saw shirrs
a song of fingers taken
and the fine fleck of dust
as white as bone motes
in the eye no beauty
here, no trick: just stark
tile, pale as the body
washed, free of dust
sluicing the day’s
darker self, down
and gone, away

item.title: 312 – Blessing (Lourdes)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Lourdes) A line of white robes penitents broken by the streamside each and every a lily billowing atop the deep blue of the Holy Font Each pause in prayer dip a finger, mangled toe, scoliosis shivering beneath the healing … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Lourdes)

A line of white robes
penitents broken
by the streamside
each and every a lily
billowing atop the deep
blue of the Holy Font

Each pause in prayer
dip a finger, mangled
toe, scoliosis shivering
beneath the healing
waters like wine
upon twisted tongues
the dumb lift shriveled hands
in loudest praise

item.title: 311 – Blessing (Breathe)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Breathe) breathe sound of being barely breeze breath sea-sound wash of grass running smooth stones to glass transparence flock of jellies flutter lungs of light filled to aching our own bones ribbed in chests breath hung in finite caves of dust infinity … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Breathe)

breathe sound of being
barely breeze breath
sea-sound wash of grass
running smooth stones
to glass transparence
flock of jellies flutter lungs
of light filled to aching
our own bones ribbed
in chests breath hung
in finite caves
of dust infinity slips
over bobbing heads
crash swirling foam
left on lips salty
kiss stings bright

item.title: 310 – Blessing (Blood)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Blood) Many myriad ways we use the blood given us. Spill out ours, others, ours for others. Look and say it is good. Is it good? Say it.
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Blood)

Many myriad ways
we use the blood
given us. Spill out
ours, others, ours
for others. Look
and say it is good.
Is it good? Say it.

item.title: 309 – Blessing (Creation)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Creation) O God of yell. of stomp. of shout. of song. of blood.love.sex.life. bursting the seams you laid in each of these stone.wolf.fir.reeds.hand.dove. trees split. cedars of Lebanon split to tangled roots. O God of dark. of silence. of … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Creation)

O God of yell. of stomp. of shout.
of song. of blood.love.sex.life. bursting
the seams you laid in each of these
stone.wolf.fir.reeds.hand.dove.
trees split. cedars of Lebanon split
to tangled roots. O God of dark.
of silence. of still small voice. O
God of haunting. where are you? where
do you come stepping? what song
is in the wind? what lips you make
to kiss your own. lips. make names
to utter Name. timbre made to shake
mountains.river.stones.cedars.stars.
what shouting! what commotion freed
from contemplation. make unto the Lord
a joyful noise, all ye ghosts and beasts.
emptied full. unthought. un-
claimed. begotten of chest.lungs.throat.lips.
break the lyre. beat the drum.
all things here below praise what it is
that gives tongues to praise.

(h/t Gungor “A Creation Liturgy”)

item.title: 308 – Blessing (Microphone)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Microphone) There’s a certain vortex Or sinkhole that tortilla chips And a glass of wine at 3:30 Opens up when the weather’s bad And dark and grey And you’ve spent too much time On LinkedIn or Facebook When the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Microphone)

There’s a certain vortex
Or sinkhole that tortilla chips
And a glass of wine at 3:30
Opens up when the weather’s bad
And dark and grey
And you’ve spent too much time
On LinkedIn or Facebook

When the geese pass by
It sounds like they’re calling to you
You’d get up and go find your flock
But your wings won’t work
Then you’re just a maniac
With a broken bell for a voice
Wandering the streets, trying to find water

It’s easy to sit and sink into the nothing
Of your own thoughts
Somehow that’s when the hand reaches out
And grabs you and holds you down
And not even the cat bunting her head
Into your will get you to move

Is that depression? Is that just the state of being
We all come to when we’re alone too long?
Unclipped from meaning, lost
Even if it’s just an afternoon
That spirals into the edges of evening
And might not come back

There’s hope somewhere
Out there in the stars
But to say so seems unfair
And cold

(This is verbatim transcription from a poem I spoke while lying on my living room floor. Talk about stream-of-consciousness. Plus I sound vaguely like Tom Waits.)

item.title: 307 – Blessing (Sound)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Sound) Scoop the sea unexpected cut sting salted angles metal-edged geometric Sound gone soft sudden sun slips in & out a wave breaksoft let it fall apart drop ping into itself leaving your cup of hands empty yet wet
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Sound)

Scoop the sea
unexpected cut

sting
salted angles

metal-edged
geometric

Sound
gone soft

sudden sun
slips in

& out
a wave

breaksoft
let it fall

apart drop
ping

into itself
leaving

your cup
of hands

empty yet
wet

item.title: 306 – Temple
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Temple I raise you. I raze you. I raised you.
